JobFullDesc:
The U.S. Regulatory Relations team is responsible for managing relationships between American Express and our U.S. regulatory agencies, as well as driving operational excellence in all regulatory interactions.  This team coordinates and guides dialogue which leads to a greater understanding of regulatory expectations within AXP/AENB, and the demonstration of such to the examiner community. 
 
The team is organized to specific risk profile areas to enable specialization, focus, and dedicated attention to the applicable internal teams, and corresponding regulators. These areas include Compliance and Finance, Technology, Data Governance and Vendor Affiliates and Enterprise Risk Management, Fraud, Credit and Operational Risk, as well as Reporting and Communications.
 
The Manager of US Regulatory Relations (USRR) – Reporting & Communications Team is responsible for a suite of ongoing and ad-hoc regulatory reporting, communications, and analytics.  This person will be in charge of gathering insights and developing reports for C-Suite executives, Board of Directors, as well as stakeholders across the organization.  Special ad-hoc projects may be assigned.  
 
The role will work closely with colleagues from USRR Continuous Monitoring Teams as well as the Global Risk & Compliance Regulatory Exam Lifecycle Management (RELM) to gather critical information and insights for our various reports and communications to ensure consistent messaging is shared with key stakeholders across all businesses and functions, which will help facilitate a seamless and cohesive experience for regulators when interacting with American Express.  
 
This person will be responsible for working with Technology and key end-users to design, improve, implement, and test solutions and functions of the capabilities for the team.
 
Responsibilities 

Lead the development of weekly, monthly and quarterly reporting to Senior Management and Regulators by working effectively with internal partners across the organization
Gather insights with use of data analytics to identify key thematic trends in regulatory activities
Develop Committee and Board level materials and other regulatory required documentation within tight deadlines
Assist in the QA process of Regulator requests for information as outlined in the performance standards
Working individually and with teams on both structured and unstructured assignments
Responsible for developing and managing data repository and project library
Serve as the product manager for USRR Site and RIMS data repository and project library for the team. Understand requirements from key end-users and work with Technology to design and implement solutions. 

 
Minimum Qualifications

Proven experience and strong skills in preparing comprehensive and effective presentation materials
Highly motivated self-starter with great personal accountability
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Intellectually curious and creative; possess a growth mind-set
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to work effectively in a matrix environment
Highly organized and great attention to detail
Work well under pressure in a fast-paced environment and able to manage several deliverables simultaneously; operate with a sense of urgency
Demonstrated ability to operate autonomously with little to no direction and escalate issues appropriately and in a timely manner
Strong inter-personal skills and a high level of business maturity; able to establish and maintain cooperative working relationships across organizations
Prior regulatory management and legal background a plus
Bachelor's degree required; MBA preferred.

 
Employment eligibility to work with American Express in the U.S. is required as the company will not pursue visa sponsorship for these positions.
